channel.title: Applied Quantitative Finance for Equity Derivatives on Jherek Healy
channel.description: Recent content in Applied Quantitative Finance for Equity Derivatives on Jherek Healy

item.title: Self-publishing, Amazon KDP vs Lulu.com
item.description: Initially, I published my book through the simplest solution, Amazon CreateSpace, now known as Amazon KDP. The experience was overall great. Amazon KDP allows to print the book in the size of our choice. The standard paper quality is good and the cover looks very much like the digitally uploaded picture. I however noticed that the second book I ordered had an issue with the binding. Some pages were not glued properly and could easily be detached.

item.title: What is so special about this book?
item.description: This site is dedicated to my book Applied Quantitative Finance for Equity Derivatives sold on Lulu. A paperback edition is also available on Amazon (US, UK, France, Germany). The book presents the most significant equity derivatives models used these days. It is not a book around esoteric or cutting-edge models, but rather a book on relatively simple and standard models, viewed from the angle of a practitioner. A lot of books present models in an abstract manner, often disconnected from how to apply those in the real world. This book is different and explains all the details needed for an implementation of the models, at the cost of being relatively succint on the mathematical origins of the various models considered.

item.title: About the cover: implied volatility fractals!
item.description: As you will have probably already noticed, the front and back pictures of my book are fractals. But they are not just any fractal. They are generated by coloring the number of iterations needed to solve the implied volatility of a vanilla option of a given price in the complex plane, using a root finding algorithm like Newton’s method or Householder’s method. Each point corresponds to a complex implied volatility guess and the more iterations needed, the darker is the point.

item.title: Citing
Erratum
item.description: This document reflects errors that were found in the first edition of the book Applied Quantitative Finance for Equity Derivatives. For the second edition, here is the corresponding erratum. If you find an error that is not listed here, please send me a note at jherekhealy @ protonmail.com. Special thanks to the readers that reported these errors.
